history.content:
You cannot enroll in a class without being enrolled in all parts of the class.

The system does not treat section enrollment any differently than lecture enrollment.

In your scenario, assuming nothing else blocking enrollment (like enrollment restrictions or time conflicts), the 15 students waitlisted for section 2 would be enrolled, since they (and only they) can enroll in all components of the class.

According to what I've learned so far, the waitlist skips you if the section you waitlisted for is full even though the class is not. I wonder if this is true vice versa, i.e., is it possible to get into a section but not the lecture?

Consider the following hypothetical situation:

Class 30/60 WL:30

Sec1 30/30 WL:15

Sec2 0/30 WL:15

Fictional student Bob is waitlisted for section 2 at 15th place and 30th place overall. What would happen when they run the waitlist?
history.subject: Regarding the waitlist algorithm
